body: This issue doesn't have to be done all at once - a new contributor can just fix a few of the javadoc warnings and that would be much appreciated.

Also, since our [our contributors guide](contributor guidelines) suggests that we follow the [boy scout rule](http://programmer.97things.oreilly.com/wiki/index.php/The_Boy_Scout_Rule), it could be a good idea that new PR fixes javadocs warnings of changed/added classes. :wink:

issue.title: Fixed JavaDoc warnings

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixed warnings for file framework/src/play-java-jpa/src/main/java/play/db/jpa/JPAApi.java

This pull request is small step in resolving issue #4995

body:
So I'm currently 80% of the way to fixing all scaladoc and javadoc warnings in the framework. This work has included the following:
- Adding `autoAPIMappings` in the default play sub-builds so their docs can talk to each other
- Providing sbt APIMappings to the scala standard library for each sub-build so their docs can reference the types in the standard library
- Hard-coding scaladoc links to java types using [the oracle java 8 javadoc base URL](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/)
  - Since scaladoc can not reference javadocs directly
- Cleaning up the documentation for thousands of classes, methods, and arguments

I still have a few questions:
- Is it best to submit what I have now (which is already a grotesquely large changeset) or just finish up the odd 500 remaining javadoc errors (all but 1 scaladoc error is fixed already)
- Once this work is done, how do you feel about an option to make scaladoc / javadoc more strict as part of the build process, so we don't get to this stage again?

Hi @eboto, there's at least one other person who has done some work on this, so I'd suggest sending a PR with everything you've done sooner rather than later.

I definitely agree with making things more strict.  At some point I'd love to enable -Xfatal-warnings in the scala/scaladoc compile, though there are a few things we'll need to address before we do that, like how to deprecate APIs but then still use them in our code (since sometimes you have to still invoke deprecated methods in order to ensure other deprecated functionality still works).

issue.title: Fix many scaladoc and javadoc warnings in apiDocs task.

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Also:
- Add autoAPIMappings to SBT build so we can link into the scala standard library
- Get inter-project external refs working in apiDocs
- Remove javadoc links in scaladoc, and hardcode them as web links instead

Addresses #4995 

Also, sorry for this grossly large PR. Made my best stab on some of this documentation but would definitely appreciate any fixes on accuracy.

issue.title: Fix all javadoc warnings, remove -Xdoclint:none

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixes #https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/4995

All the javadoc warnings are fixed, and -Xdoclint:none is removed from the javadoc.
